title: Cinderhulk is underpowered in earlygame, here is an idea to balance it
body:
Greetings Summoners,

{{item:1409}}  is the first item you must buy when you play a tanky jungler, but the problem is, it's not a good item until lategame. In addition, {{item:3068}}  is similar to {{item:1409}} in earlygame, except that it gives + 60 armor. Don't get me wrong, I know that as {{item:1409}} is cheaper, and gives the features of both {{item:1039}} and {{item:1041}}  as well as a smite improvement, it is absolutely legit that it be inferior to {{item:3068}} . However, in my honest opinion it is still too weak. This is why I personally build {{item:1039}} + {{item:3068}} on junglers like {{champion:154}} , {{champion:32}} ...

Here are my ideas.

First of all, we make {{item:3068}}  deal no bonus damage to monsters, so that it would not be an option for junglers.

Second, we make {{item:1409}} a more viable choice for junglers, especially in earlygame :

{{item:1409}}  :
+25 armor
+300 hp (nerfed from 400)
+10% bonus health (nerfed from 15%)

This means we need a new build path : 2625 gold = {{item:3711}}  (1000 gold) + {{item:3751}}  (1100 gold) + {{item:1029}} (300 gold) + 225 gold

=> Some armor would allow junglers to take less damage when they clear their camps. I think it's annoying having to build armor in addition to my jungle item to be able to jungle without taking too much damage.

=> +400hp=>+300hp and 15%=>10% nerf : As we add armor to the item, we have to nerf the hp it gives.

If we apply my ideas:

=> In earlygame, with only {{item:1409}} you would get 330hp and 25 armor (value : 1380 gold) instead of 460hp (value : 1200 gold). (+180 gold value in earlygame)

=> In lategame, with a full tank build like {{item:3047}} {{item:1409}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3193}} {{item:3083}} (+1950 bonus hp with my Cinderhulk, +2050 bonus hp with the current one)  you would get 495hp and 25 armor (value : 1820 gold) instead of 707,5hp (value : 1885 gold). (-65 gold value in lategame)

As you can see, the item is a tiny bit less powerful in lategame, but there is a true difference in earlygame, as you get some armor to clear the jungle.

This means {{item:1409}} would just be more balanced

In the meantime, {{item:3068}} would still be better than {{item:1409}} (as it gives +425hp and +60 armor for a value of 2330 gold).

Thank you for reading, I hope you like my idea, if you don't please tell me why in the comments and maybe we can try to improve it !

Rito please try this on PBE :D

replies.body:
Just bump the HP bonus from 15% to 20%. Tank junglers being a bit weak early is fine, but they need to scale better.

Besides it's good to have at least one strong HP item.
{{champion:31}} YESS
cinderhulk is just boring in general. Especially if you want to have an impact early game. Playing with cinderhulk is too underwhelming. I just build the AD item, then build sunfire afterwards.
Sure, with Jarvan or Wukong you take Warrior then Sunfire if u want. But as OP said we talk about tank junglers, not fighers

Yeah but that's exactly why i want to make cinderhulk better. I'm talking about the tank junglers that don't want an offensive jungle enchantment, like {{champion:113}} , {{champion:421}} , {{champion:32}} , {{champion:154}} , {{champion:79}}, {{champion:57}}  ...

Gragas, Azmumu, Zac can all build Runic viably, giving them a much larger early game threat, which gives them stronger ganks, faster clears and better kill threat in early teamfighting. Rek'Sai can do the same thing with warrior. Sejuani is about the only one there who doesn't want to build any of the available offensive options and is currently doing quite well for herself.

Back in season 2 and season 3 when jungle items sucked and exp wasn't tied directly to an item, I would actually start my jungle out with cloth and 4 red potions. (They were a lot cheaper back then)  Now, because exp is tied to a specific item, there's no room to build off anything but the two starting items. They should put the exp tied to the Smite summon. This way if a champion wants to build {{item:3068}} instead of {{item:1401}} he can.

And what about health and mana regen ? I also think Machete and Talisman are not very balanced, but Riot created the smite improvement + enchantment system to make every possible jungler happy in the jungle. When we jungle, we're supposed to buy the jungle items they created, but the only problem i see here is that cinderhulk is too weak in earlygame. However It would be interesting to suggest a new system for experience and itemization in the jungle, you should write a post and comment the link here :)

I was simply pointing out that back in the early days of this game it didn't matter what item you bought you didn't see a loss in exp. Now, you HAVE to buy a jungle item or you're going to be missing out on, I think its 30% exp from jungle monsters. Junglers no longer have an option of what they want to build. They MUST have a jungle item to be relevant.
I personally think they could simply add an addition to smite. It already heals health, so why not also allow it to heal mana?

I would just suggest a base health increase to make up for the lost HP of tank items.

Only junglers build cinderhulk, that wouldn't be fair for other tanks. Plus, as said in the post, Cinderhulk is already a good item strong in lategame, and if we just increase base health, it will be too strong. The purpose here is to help tank junglers in earlygame :)
I am 99% sure he means increase the actual health on the item since it is STILL one of the lowest HP giving items AFTER every other health item got knocked down 50-100.
"the actual" health is 400+300=700 in lategame

Except it is still the least cost effective jungle enchantment BY FAR. You need 1000 bonus health (in addition to the 400 the item gives) before the enchantment even breaks even in cost effeciency without counting the burn passive (which doesn't amount to much considering Riot nerfed it this patch to champions which is the only relevant damage number).
here is a solution. don't build cinder. if you're behind. build it but at that point you will probably lose because cinder junglers dont scale well due to bork

I think simply increasing the bonus damage to monsters of {{item:3751}} would be much more effective. That way tanks clear faster and can't get counterjungled anymore that easily. The changes to Cinderhulk went into the right direction already.

Which is why you should not upgrade your jg item until after you reach a certain lvl, i stay with its components, build some item in the meantime, and then upgrade it. cinderhulk does not have a base damage but instead is lvl based which is why I usually do this.

But the enchantment is supposed to be the thing you rush... AD junglers have Warrior's power spike, AP junglers have runic echoes, and DPS junglers have Bloodrazor. If you're a tank, you need to deal damage to monsters, so you need your immolate passive fast, don't you think ?

Honestly the bigger problem is the fact that Cinderhulk (and Sunfire) do 4x the damage of Bami's Cinder for.....some reason. I am fine with them doing more damage, but 4x is a bit ridiculous considering other junglers spend gold for actually damaging jungle monsters in the the path towards their jungle item. Bami's Cinder makes you clear....barely faster than not having it whereas 2x Dagger/2x Longsword/2x Amp Tome increase speeds by a fairly great deal and then get further increased when Bloodrazor/Warrior/Echoes are completed.
cinder is actually ridic right now. with hp being a rarer resource giving it a boost is crazy.

Sounds like a good idea.

However a tank jungler probably wouldn't build Warmog's Armor. The item isn't very good and completely checked out and outright worse than ever tank item. The item needs a rework (aka no more out of combat regen).
